entries.meaning: Any fish in the taxonomic family Priacanthidae, which have large eyes.
Any of certain fish or shark species identified by their large eyes, in particular bigeye tuna, Thunnus obesus.
examples: There were Port Jackson sharks with a brown back, a whitish belly, and eleven rows of teeth, bigeye sharks with necks marked by a large black spot encircled in white and resembling an eye, and Isabella sharks whose rounded snouts were strewn with dark speckles.
